result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Fabrice P Morgan

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Fabrice P Morgan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jason Carlos Gonzalez in court for Fabrice P Morgan.  Attorney Careen Marie Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: South Milwaukee Police Officer M. Hill. State rest. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 34. Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Fabrice P Morgan not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Gonzalez is in trial in Dane County.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Letter to Commissioner Dorsey requesting adjournment of Preliminary Hearing received and filed.  bm
Notice of Retainer received and filed.  bm

Defendant Fabrice P Morgan not in court, in custody.  Attorney Brett Lee Copeland in court in person for Fabrice P Morgan.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel informs the court that the defendant would like a Preliminary Hearing date. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Fabrice P Morgan not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with AMS and her family, HS, ES, MS.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order. If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Fabrice P Morgan in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Fabrice P Morgan in custody. Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Fabrice P Morgan appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY. Defendant may qualify for public defender representation if defendant loses his job. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). 
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
